definition.text: Optical prism at the shape of a half cube with light input and output at the surface at the leg of a right triangle which deflects the beam 90° and inverts the image
Five-sided reflecting prism which deflects the beam 90° invariant to low changes of the input angle of the beam and it has no invertion of the image
Optical prism with a base area of a parallelogram which realizes a displacement of the beam without any invertion
Optical prism with three reflecting surfaces perpendicular to each other (corner of a cube) which reflects a beam in its opposite direction invariant to the input angle of the beam

Optical prism with a base area of a isosceles triangle with non perpendicular light input and output at the surfaces that are perpendicular to the basic area at the two equal legs of the triangle which deflects the light at different angles per wavelength
Sub-group (4th level) for objects that cannot be classified into other specified sub-groups in the existing structure, but that are classified to their parent-class on the 3rd level

Lens in an array with an aperture of less than a few millimetres including lenses which work by refraction at the surface, refraction in the bulk of the substrate, diffraction or a combination of these

document_identifier.label: DIN EN ISO 14880-1:2005-05, ISO 14880-1 Technical Corrigendum 1:2003-08

definition.text: Instrument whose function is mainly based on optical phenomena, consisting of several assemblies and/or components, illumination systems, instruments with light conduction and instruments which, apart from optical units, contain assemblies and/or components from other fields, e.g. electronic components
Instrument for enhancement of the power of seeing, that means to make visible infinitesimal details which are invisible for the normal eye. Delineation to segment 21, 32, 34 see note
Type of microscope which uses visible light and a system of lenses to magnify images of small samples. Delineation to segment 32 see note
Type of microscope that uses an electron beam to illuminate a specimen and produce a magnified image

First part of an imaging system consisting of a lens, its frame and other related parts, which alone or in connection with a tube lens create a primary image of the object. Delineation to segment 19, 24, 27 see note
Sub-group (4th level) for objects that cannot be classified into other specified sub-groups in the existing structure, but that are classified to their parent-class on the 3rd level
Special objective which uses lens elements and mirrors for imaging
Sub-group (4th level) for objects with spare part characteristics that maintain or re-store the original condition of the objects classified under the parent-class on the 3rd level
Objective of variable focal length in which the change of focal length is realized under movement of an optical component or subassembly without a change of the object and image plane
Sub-group (4th level) for objects with complemental characteristics, without which the basic function of the objects classified under the parent-class on the 3rd level is still guaranteed
Objective used for microscopical imaging with a standardized thread for the connection to the microscope
Instrument that makes objects in the distance appear larger
Sub-group (4th level) for objects that cannot be classified into other specified sub-groups in the existing structure, but that are classified to their parent-class on the 3rd level

Pair of identical or mirror-symmetrical telescopes mounted side-by-side and aligned to point accurately in the same direction, allowing the viewer to use both eyes (binocular vision) when viewing distant objects. Delineation to segment 41 see note
Sub-group (4th level) for objects with spare part characteristics that maintain or re-store the original condition of the objects classified under the parent-class on the 3rd level
Optical instrument at monocular design for making distant objects appear nearer and consequently larger
Sub-group (4th level) for objects with complemental characteristics, without which the basic function of the objects classified under the parent-class on the 3rd level is still guaranteed

Sighting device based on an optical refracting telescope equipped with some form of graphic image pattern (a reticle) mounted in an optically appropriate position in their optical system to give an accurate aiming point
Portable telescope with added optics to present an erect image, optimized for the observation of terrestrial objects
Sub-group (4th level) for objects that cannot be classified into other specified sub-groups in the existing structure, but that are classified to their parent-class on the 3rd level
Sub-group (4th level) for objects with spare part characteristics that maintain or re-store the original condition of the objects classified under the parent-class on the 3rd level
Sub-group (4th level) for objects with complemental characteristics, without which the basic function of the objects classified under the parent-class on the 3rd level is still guaranteed

Filter consisting of a glass or plastic substrate having a coating that uses the phenomenon of interference to transmit or reflect radiation in a chosen spectral range, the unwanted radiation being reflected or transmitted respectively
Between object and eye used lens for image magnification at the retina of the eye. Delineation to segment 21, 34 see note
Magnifier with a swing away case designed to be used as a handle when the magnifier is in use and a protective case when not in use
Magnifier with handle
Magnifier which is held with a band on the head
Combination of magnifier and eyeglasses, magnifier is worn like eyeglasses
Magnifier including illumination source
Sub-group (4th level) for objects that cannot be classified into other specified sub-groups in the existing structure, but that are classified to their parent-class on the 3rd level

Group (3rd level) for objects that cannot be classified into other specified groups in the existing structure, but that are classified to their parent-class on the 2nd level. A xx-xx-90-00-class cannot have any other sub-groups besides the generic xx-xx-90-90-class (…(Other, unspecified)) to be generally valid within the parent class on the 2nd level
Group of lenses designed to compensate the axial chromatical aberration for two defined wavelengths
Sub-group (4th level) for objects that cannot be classified into other specified sub-groups in the existing structure, but that are classified to their parent-class on the 3rd level
At least one optical component or optical assembly mounted in a mechanical mount / holder
Optical element or group nearest to the eye in an optical imaging system, used for viewing the image formed by the objective
Sub-group (4th level) for objects that cannot be classified into other specified sub-groups in the existing structure, but that are classified to their parent-class on the 3rd level
Opto mechanical assembly with on a circle arranged filters
Sub-group (4th level) for objects that cannot be classified into other specified sub-groups in the existing structure, but that are classified to their parent-class on the 3rd level

Group (3rd level) for objects that cannot be classified into other specified groups in the existing structure, but that are classified to their parent-class on the 2nd level. A xx-xx-90-00-class cannot have any other sub-groups besides the generic xx-xx-90-90-class (…(Other, unspecified)) to be generally valid within the parent class on the 2nd level
Sub-group (4th level) for objects that cannot be classified into other specified sub-groups in the existing structure, but that are classified to their parent-class on the 3rd level

Segment includes products and technologies that deal with the generation, manipulation and detection of light. This includes optical instruments such as microscopes, telescopes, cameras and glasses, optical components such as lenses, prisms and mirrors as well as laser technology and photonic systems. Other products with a focus on electrical engineering are not included in this subject area but are part of segment 27.
Eyeglasses with one distinct optical power made from organic material
Reflecting surface which is completely flat
Eyeglasses are characterised by a gradient of increasing lens power of organic material which realise a sharp seeing at the near and the distance
Optical element that collects as large a solid angle of light as possible from a source and focuses it on the required object
Sub-group (4th level) for objects that cannot be classified into other specified sub-groups in the existing structure, but that are classified to their parent-class on the 3rd level
Regular arrangement of microlenses on a single substrate. Delineation to segment 42 see note

document_identifier.label: DIN EN ISO 14880-1:2005-05, ISO 14880-1 Technical Corrigendum 1:2003-08, ISO 14880-1:2001-08

definition.text: Eyeglasses with two distinct optical powers made from mineral material. Bifocals are most commonly prescribed to people with presbyopia who also require a correction for myopia, hyperopia, and/or astigmatism
Prism with a small angle between its input and output surfaces

document_identifier.label: in Anlehnung an DIN EN ISO 2538:2003-05

definition.text: Element of transparent material with not less than two nonparallel planar surfaces which is useable for dispersion or reflection of light at an angle. Delineation to segment 21 see note
Prism with two reflections and a typical beam deflection of 45° to 60°, no flipping or rotation of the image
Optical prism at the shape of a half cube with light input and output at the surface at the leg of a right triangle which deflects the beam 90° and inverts the image
Equipment based on an optical system that makes use of reflection. Delineation to segment 21, 22, 27, 34 see note
Optical component using a spherical surface for reflection
Optical component which uses an aspherical surface for reflection
Optical component which uses a free form surface for reflection
Sub-group (4th level) for objects that cannot be classified into other specified sub-groups in the existing structure, but that are classified to their parent-class on the 3rd level
Sub-group (4th level) for objects with spare part characteristics that maintain or re-store the original condition of the objects classified under the parent-class on the 3rd level
Sub-group (4th level) for objects with complemental characteristics, without which the basic function of the objects classified under the parent-class on the 3rd level is still guaranteed
Optical instrument for viewing objects that are above the level of direct sight or in an otherwise obstructed field of vision
Sub-group (4th level) for objects that cannot be classified into other specified sub-groups in the existing structure, but that are classified to their parent-class on the 3rd level

Group (3rd level) for objects that cannot be classified into other specified groups in the existing structure, but that are classified to their parent-class on the 2nd level. A xx-xx-90-00-class cannot have any other sub-groups besides the generic xx-xx-90-90-class (…(Other, unspecified)) to be generally valid within the parent class on the 2nd level
Sub-group (4th level) for objects that cannot be classified into other specified sub-groups in the existing structure, but that are classified to their parent-class on the 3rd level

Eyeglasses with two distinct optical powers made from organic material. Bifocals are most commonly prescribed to people with presbyopia who also require a correction for myopia, hyperopia, and/or astigmatism
Eyeglasses with one distinct optical power made from mineral material

Materials containing a high molecular weight polymer as an essential ingredient and which, at any stage of processing into finished products, can be formed by flow. For delimitation to segments 20, 30, 31, 35, 37 see note
Chemical compound, usually of low molecular mass, that can be converted into a polymer by combining it with itself or with other chemical compounds

High molecular weight molecule, natural or synthetic, whose chemical structure can be represented by repeated small units which collectively form molecular chains. Note: This material class has three main sub-groups: elastomers, thermoplastics and thermosets
Sub-group (4th level) for objects that cannot be classified into other specified sub-groups in the existing structure, but that are classified to their parent-class on the 3rd level
Linear pattern whose transmittance or reflectance varies periodically in all but one azimuth where it is constant. Delineation to segment 22 see note
Sub-group (4th level) for objects that cannot be classified into other specified sub-groups in the existing structure, but that are classified to their parent-class on the 3rd level
Calcium fluoride crystals for optical applications, synthetic, high purity. Delineation to segment 38 see note
Quadrilateral fabricated parts, consisting of Calcium fluoride, all six sides are worked, the edges have protective bevels and they are usually described by length, width and thickness
At all surface machined cylindrical parts, consisting of Calcium fluoride, for which the diameter is larger than the thickness, described by diameter and thickness
Sub-group (4th level) for objects that cannot be classified into other specified sub-groups in the existing structure, but that are classified to their parent-class on the 3rd level
Polycrystalline materials produced by controlled crystallization of basic glass. For delimitation to segments 22, 35 see note
Quadrilateral fabricated parts, consisting of glass ceramic, all six sides are worked, the edges have protective bevels and they are usually described by length, width and thickness
At all surfaces machined cylindrical part, consisting of glass ceramic, for which the diameter is larger than the thickness, described by diameter and thickness
Sub-group (4th level) for objects that cannot be classified into other specified sub-groups in the existing structure, but that are classified to their parent-class on the 3rd level

Group (3rd level) for objects that cannot be classified into other specified groups in the existing structure, but that are classified to their parent-class on the 2nd level. A xx-xx-90-00-class cannot have any other sub-groups besides the generic xx-xx-90-90-class (…(Other, unspecified)) to be generally valid within the parent class on the 2nd level
Sub-group (4th level) for objects that cannot be classified into other specified sub-groups in the existing structure, but that are classified to their parent-class on the 3rd level
Functional unit consisting of several optical components
Assembly of not less than two connected lenses
Group of two lenses
Group of three lenses designed to compensate the axial chromatical aberration for two defined wavelengths and also the astigmatism
Optical Glass with spezific absorption properties to influence spezifically the spectral radiation allocation at the optical wavelength area
Sub-group (4th level) for objects that cannot be classified into other specified sub-groups in the existing structure, but that are classified to their parent-class on the 3rd level
Sub-group (4th level) for objects that cannot be classified into other specified sub-groups in the existing structure, but that are classified to their parent-class on the 3rd level
Subassembly of not less than two connected optical components, at least one of them is a prism
Prism group containing two optical prisms in form of a half cube with light in- and output at the surface at the hypotenuse of a right triangle which totally rotate the image by 180°

Prism group containing one double reflecting optical prism in form of a half cube and two smaller only one time reflecting prisms in form of a half cube, optical path deflected four times at 90°, no vertical offset of the light path
Cubical component of two connected semicubeprisms
Sub-group (4th level) for objects that cannot be classified into other specified sub-groups in the existing structure, but that are classified to their parent-class on the 3rd level
Component made of transparent material with one or more curved surfaces, which is used for systematic change in the light beam direction. Delineation to segment 27, 34 see note

Group (3rd level) for objects that cannot be classified into other specified groups in the existing structure, but that are classified to their parent-class on the 2nd level. A xx-xx-90-00-class cannot have any other sub-groups besides the generic xx-xx-90-90-class (…(Other, unspecified)) to be generally valid within the parent class on the 2nd level
Lens with two spherical surfaces whereas one of them may have a planar surface with a infinite radius
Sub-group (4th level) for objects that cannot be classified into other specified sub-groups in the existing structure, but that are classified to their parent-class on the 3rd level
Lens with not less than one surface described by a aspheric formula
Part providing a function in optical imaging
Lens with two cylindrical surfaces whereas which one of them may be a planar surface with an infinite radius
Cylindrical optical component, which transmitted the light in direction of the cylinder axis
Lens with at least one surface described by a freeform description
Sub-group (4th level) for objects that cannot be classified into other specified sub-groups in the existing structure, but that are classified to their parent-class on the 3rd level
Axial stepped lens with one in form of rings stepped surface so that the thickness of the lens is reduced (at same focal length)

Micro- and nano-optical components and systems like refractive and diffractive miniaturised optics, dielectrical and metallical gratings, computer generated holograms, photonic crystals and metamaterials for using in lightning, projection, information technology, laser technology, power engineering and metrology
Optical elements for the spectral range of 800 nm – 12 µm made from material like germanium, silicon, zinc sulphide, calcium fluoride and gallium arsenide
Multilayer micro-optics modules based on repeated usage of lithographical structuring in touch with coating and UV-structuring
Optical element with two planar surfaces

Photo made by holographic techniques, which reproduce an exact three-dimensional image of the original object after processing and illuminating with special homogenous light. Delineation to segment 24 see note
Sub-group (4th level) for objects that cannot be classified into other specified sub-groups in the existing structure, but that are classified to their parent-class on the 3rd level
Sub-group (4th level) for objects that cannot be classified into other specified sub-groups in the existing structure, but that are classified to their parent-class on the 3rd level
Eyeglass lens which is located in front of the eye without any direct contact to the eye. Delineation to segment 34, 40 see note
Sub-group (4th level) for objects that cannot be classified into other specified sub-groups in the existing structure, but that are classified to their parent-class on the 3rd level

Regularly transmitting device used to modify the radiant or luminous flux, the relative spectral distribution, or both, of the radiation passing through it. A distinction is made between selective filters and non-selective filters or neutral filters or neutral grey filters according as they do or do not alter the relative spectral distribution of the radiation. A selective filter that makes a significant change in the chromaticity of the radiation is called a coloured filter, one that alters the spectral distribution but, because of metamerism, transmits radiation of nearly the same chromaticity as that of the incident radiation, may be called a grey filter. Delineation to segment 19, 27 see note
Filter which transmitted light of a special colour- or wavelength characteristics
Filter for defined oscillation direction of light in use of the total or partial absorption
Optical filter, which reduces the intensity of light in the ultraviolet spectral range
Optical filter, which reduces the intensity of light in the infrared spectral range
Sub-group (4th level) for objects that cannot be classified into other specified sub-groups in the existing structure, but that are classified to their parent-class on the 3rd level
Material that has main properties usable for optical imaging

Inorganic product produced by melting, which in principle solidifies without crystallization, intended for use in optical systems specified by its index of refraction, transmission of light, optical and material properties. Delineation to segment 22, 34 see note
Fine annealed glass blocks suitable for cold working with up to five unworked, as-cast surfaces, usually at least one surface is worked, described by length, width and thickness
Either gross annealed or fine annealed strips with unworked surface and broken or cut ends
Quadrilateral fabricated parts, consisting of glass, all six sides are worked, the edges have protective bevels and they are usually described by length, width and thickness
At all surface machined cylindrical parts, consisting of glass, for which the diameter is larger than the thickness, described by diameter and thickness
Pressed blank is a hot-formed part, consisting of glass, with mostly round cross section, with defined radii and bevels. Described by Diameter, center thickness, radius 1, radius 2, bevels
Raw sphere made from optical glass with a diameter near by the double of the radius of the manufactured sphere lens
Raw round rod made from optical glass
Eyeglasses are characterised by a gradient of increasing lens power of mineral material which realise a sharp seeing at the near and the distance
Sub-group (4th level) for objects that cannot be classified into other specified sub-groups in the existing structure, but that are classified to their parent-class on the 3rd level

Glass consisting of high-purity silica (SiO2) in amorphous (non-crystalline) form, with superior optical and physical properties for the use in the optical industry. Delineation to segment 22, 27 see note
Quadrilateral fabricated parts, consisting of fused silica, all six sides are worked, the edges have protective bevels and they are usually described by length, width and thickness
At all surfaces machined cylindrical part, consisting of fused silica, for which the diameter is larger than the thickness, described by diameter and thickness
Sub-group (4th level) for objects that cannot be classified into other specified sub-groups in the existing structure, but that are classified to their parent-class on the 3rd level
Germanium crystals for optical applications (high purity > 99,999%) crystalline germanium dioxide compound = optical mono- / polycrystal. Delineation to segment 38 see note
Quadrilateral fabricated parts, consisting of Germanium, all six sides are worked, the edges have protective bevels and they are usually described by length, width and thickness
At all surfaces machined cylindrical part, consisting of Germanium, for which the diameter is larger than the thickness, described by diameter and thickness
Asset (empty)
hierarchical dictionary of products, systems and services according to a logical structure and levels of detail corresponding to the specific properties of these products
representation of a type or family of product (device, equipment, software or service) which can be described by a generic set of properties
